intro:
Some guy who's very interested in free software and federated networks. Also justice and fighting poverty and climate change.

Not a programmer, but might have some useful thoughts nonetheless.

post.body: Hi! So, who should I follow on this thing?

All I had to do to get a username here was to write the username. No password or anything else. Convenient, but…

This makes me wonder: Can I log in as the same user on more than one device? What happens if I get a new PC if this one is stolen or gets hosed?

Is it likely that at some point, like the next time I do a clean install of my OS, I will lose my account and all the connections I've added at that time?

Please enlighten me, if anyone sees this. Thanks! :)

PS: Anyone else here who was active on Identi.ca back in the day?
Cool stuff: "Code an improvement to a free/libre and open-source platform for real-time, decentralized apps, and you could win a €1,000, €2,000, or €3,000 prize" http://swellrt.org/contest/

90% off all of Versos ebooks today, and they're all DRM free and available as epub: https://www.versobooks.com/

What about a book by George Monbiot, for example? https://www.versobooks.com/books/2092-how-did-we-get-into-this-mess

comment.body: @Jayofthezero: Thank you! I feel like this should've been made clear upon creating the account.
And some great hacktivist books, including one by Aaron Swartz: http://www.versobooks.com/blogs/2575-psst-downloading-isn-t-stealing-for-today
